title: P06-2012

sentences.text: This paper presents an unsupervised learning approach to disambiguate various relations between named entities by use of various lexical and syntactic features from the contexts .

It works by calculating eigenvectors of an adjacency graph 's Laplacian to recover a submanifold of data from a high dimensionality space and then performing cluster number estimation on the eigenvectors .
Experiment results on ACE corpora show that this spectral clustering based approach outperforms the other clustering methods .

Entity-an_unsupervised_learning_approach.label: an unsupervised learning approach
Entity-an_unsupervised_learning_approach.description: A methodology that uses eigenvectors of an adjacency graph's Laplacian to recover a submanifold of data from high dimensionality space and perform cluster number estimation, without requiring labeled training data.

Entity-this_spectral_clustering_based_ap.label: this spectral clustering based approach
Entity-this_spectral_clustering_based_ap.description: A method of unsupervised learning that uses eigenvectors to recover submanifolds from high-dimensional spaces and estimate cluster numbers, applied in named entity disambiguation.

Entity-calculating_eigenvectors_of_an_ad.label: calculating eigenvectors of an adjacency graph's Laplacian
aliases: calculating eigenvectors of an adjacency graph's Laplacian
Entity-calculating_eigenvectors_of_an_ad.description: A mathematical algorithm used in spectral clustering, which involves computing the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the Laplacian matrix derived from an adjacency graph.

mentions.local_name: calculating eigenvectors of an adjacency graph's Laplacian

Entity-it_work.label: It works
Entity-it_work.description: The method used in this paper's unsupervised learning approach to disambiguate various relations between named entities.

Entity-then_performing_cluster_number_es.label: then performing cluster number estimation on the eigenvectors
aliases: then performing cluster number estimation on the eigenvectors
Entity-then_performing_cluster_number_es.description: The process of estimating the optimal number of clusters in a dataset by applying clustering algorithms to the eigenvectors calculated from an adjacency graph's Laplacian.

mentions.local_name: then performing cluster number estimation on the eigenvectors

Entity-this_paper.label: This paper

Entity-spectral_clustering_based_approac.description: A data analysis methodology or algorithm that uses spectral clustering techniques to group similar entities.

aliases: recover a submanifold of data from a high dimensionality space

Entity-adjacency_graph.description: A mathematical representation that shows how nodes or vertices are connected to each other, often used in graph theory and data structure applications.

Entity-the_other_clustering_method.description: Various clustering algorithms and techniques used in machine learning, excluding the presented spectral clustering method.

Entity-s_laplacian.description: The matrix representing the linear operator that plays a key role in graph theory, particularly in spectral clustering.

Entity-laplacian.description: A mathematical concept that represents an operator used in linear algebra to analyze graph structures.

summary: This paper presents an unsupervised learning approach to disambiguate various relations between named entities by use of various lexical and syntactic features from the contexts . It works by calculating eigenvectors of an adjacency graph 's Laplacian to recover a submanifold of data from a high dimensionality space and then performing cluster number estimation on the eigenvectors . Experiment results on ACE corpora show that this spectral clustering based approach outperforms the other clustering methods .

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates that the subject provides or offers something to someone or for a specific purpose. It implies a sense of introduction, exposition, or revelation, where the subject brings forth information, ideas, methods, or solutions.

Predicate-disambiguate_various_relations.label: disambiguate various relations between named entities
Predicate-disambiguate_various_relations.description: To clarify and distinguish different types of relationships or associations that exist among a set of identified entities (named entities), such as people, organizations, locations, etc. This process involves identifying and resolving ambiguities or uncertainties surrounding these relationships.

Predicate-disambiguate_various_relations.label: disambiguate various relations between
Predicate-disambiguate_various_relations.description: To identify and clarify the different types of relationships or connections that exist between two sets of entities (the subject and object), often involving semantic analysis to resolve ambiguities.

Predicate-calculates.label: calculates
Predicate-calculates.description: The predicate 'calculates' represents a mathematical operation that connects the subject to an object by indicating that the subject performs or executes some kind of calculation on, with respect to, or involving the object. This connection implies a relationship between the subject and the object where the subject is actively processing information related to the object.

Predicate-are_calculated_by.label: are calculated by
Predicate-are_calculated_by.description: The predicate 'are calculated by' indicates a relationship where the subject (in this case, eigenvectors) has its values determined or derived from the object (the Laplacian), often through some mathematical process or algorithm. This connection implies that the subject's properties or characteristics are influenced or generated by the object in question.

Predicate-works_by.label: works by
Predicate-works_by.description: The predicate 'works by' indicates a means or method by which something (the subject) accomplishes its purpose, function, or outcome. It describes how the subject achieves its intended result, often highlighting the underlying process, mechanism, or technique used to produce that outcome.

Predicate-show_that.label: show that
Predicate-show_that.description: To demonstrate or prove something through evidence or experimentation. The predicate 'show that' indicates a causal relationship between the subject and object, where the subject (e.g., an experiment) provides empirical support for the truth of the statement expressed by the object (e.g., this spectral clustering based approach).

Predicate-outperforms.label: outperforms
Predicate-outperforms.description: The predicate 'outperforms' indicates a comparison between two entities or approaches that suggests one has achieved better results, effectiveness, or performance than another. It implies superiority in terms of quality, efficiency, accuracy, or other relevant metrics.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates a relationship of employment or utilization between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject relies on, employs, or exploits the object to achieve some purpose or goal.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: Indicates that the subject concept is more general than or encompasses the object concept in some hierarchical classification system.
